intro: Spermacoce radicans, commonly known as wandering jew, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom throughout the growing season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation and spread.
